item.title: Report E-2024010221
item.description:
Report E-2024010221

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-17T15:11:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-11
  • City: GRAND RAPIDS
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XGR experienced a UN2491 Bonderite L-GP 505 Corrosion Inhibitor release from a 55-gallon metal drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 50-gallons of product released to an 8' x 10' area of the trailer floor and a 10' x 25' area of the asphalt dock as well as a catch basin. The release was due to a forklift puncture to the bottom of the drum. The damaged drum was placed into an 85-gallon poly overpack. Absorbents were deployed to clean the impacted trailer floor and collected into (3) 55-gallon poly drums. A pressure washer and vac unit along with citric acid solution were then utilized to clean the impacted asphalt and catch basin. All impacted wastewater was placed into (7) 250-gallon poly totes. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024010177
item.description:
Report E-2024010177

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-17T15:11:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-28
  • City: WATERFORD TOWNSHIP
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Hepaco was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 4ft-by-4ft area of the concrete terminal floor and estimated that two (2) gallons of material was released due to a puncture during improper unloading to one (1) 330-gallon metal tote. Hepaco personnel applied a patch kit to the damaged weld seam on the metal tote and containerized the impacted carboard that was used by terminal personnel as absorbents into one 55-gallon metal drum along with absorbent pads and PPE used by Hepaco personnel. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal prior to the contractor demobilization and will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024010136
item.description:
Report X-2024010136

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-11T15:12:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-29
  • City: ROMULUS
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: AN AIR FIVE GALLON PAIL WAS INSPECTED DUE TO TRIGGER TERM WRITTEN ON THE TOP OF THE PAIL. THE PAIL INDICATED A WASTE WAS BEING SHIPPED. UPON FURTHER INSPECTION OF THE PAIL AN SDS WAS ATTACHED SHOWING THE CONTENTS TO BE REGULATED IN AIR TRANSPORTATION AS CALCIUM OXIDE. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER PAIL TO INDICATE A REGULATED DANGEROUS GOODS WAS BEING SHIPPED.
